instruction: What kinds of spectrum can be used for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB)?
Output: The related study used visible and nir spectrum for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB)?
Output: Statistical, radiative transfer model (RTM), machine learning (ML), and deep learning (DL) approaches were used for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB).

instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB)?
Output: The metric chosen for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB) was the Nitrogen Nutrient Index (NNI). This metric can go as far as measuring the crop N status by comparing actual CNC to critical CNC levels.

instruction: What were the performance metrics used to evaluate the modeling approaches for estimating CNC and AGB in the related study?
Output: The performance metrics used to evaluate the modeling approaches for estimating CNC and AGB in the related study were R2test (coefficient of determination) and NRMSEtest (normalized root mean square error).

instruction: Can the use of VNIR spectral reflectance data for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB) be considered superior to traditional methods in precision agriculture?
Output: Yes. Based on the information provided in the related study, the use of VNIR spectral reflectance data for estimating crop canopy nitrogen concentration (CNC) and aboveground biomass (AGB) can be considered superior to traditional methods in precision agriculture. The related study mentions that VNIR spectral response has been widely used to estimate CNC and AGB of canopies. Additionally, machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) techniques, such as partial least squares regression (PLSR) and convolutional neural network (CNN), have emerged as promising approaches for mapping CNC and AGB using VNIR spectral reflectance. These models showed good performance in predicting CNC and AGB in the test data. Furthermore, the VNIR spectral reflectance data was found to be informative for CNC and AGB models.
